bestBHT.bht: Entering the tomb, they were amazed to find a figure clothed in a long white garment, radiating a supernatural brightness. This description hints at the appearance of the angel, who seemed to be in the bloom of a life untouched by decay. The purpose of the angels was to comfort and instruct the disciples, yet the mysterious disappearances and reappearances may perplex us. The angel's dazzling white robe signifies his divine nature, a heavenly messenger sent to bring awe and wonder to those who behold him.

Henry Alford: Here he is described as he appeared, and we are left to infer what he was.
The incident to which these accounts point, must be distinct from that related John xx. 11.
They present curious examples of the ingenuity, and (probably unconscious) disingenuousness, of the Harmonists.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: he is described as he appeared to the eye, in the bloom of a life that knows no decay.
having respect to the position in which His Lord had lain there. This trait is peculiar to Mark.
clothed in a long white garment—On its length, see :-; and on its whiteness, see on :-.
Marvin Vincent: Affrighted. See Mark 9:15, and Introduction. Rev., better, amazed. It was wonder rather than fright.
Philip Schaff: Mark thus vividly describes an angel.
The mission of the angels was to comfort and instruct the disciples, not to perplex them and us by the mysterious disappearances and reappearances.
A supernatural brightness may be implied, as in chap. Mark 9:3. Comp. Matthew 28:3; Luke 24:4.
Archibald T. Robertson: Entering into the tomb (εισελθουσα εις το μνημειον). Told also by Luke 24:3, though not by Matthew.
Arrayed in a white robe (περιβεβλημενον στολην λευκην). Perfect passive participle with the accusative case of the thing retained (verb of clothing). Luke 24:4 has 'in dazzling apparel.'

They were amazed (εξεθαμβηθησαν). They were utterly (εξ in composition) amazed. Luke 24:5 has it 'affrighted.' Matthew 28:3 tells more of the raiment white as snow which made the watchers quake and become as dead men.
John Gill: They saw a young man; an angel; as angels used to appear in the form of men.
And there being a door into one of these caves, persons might enter in, and see where the graves were, and the bodies lay.
clothed long white garment: John 20:12- :; which was as white as snow.

bhtAttempts.bht: As they entered the tomb, they saw a figure dressed in a long white garment, radiating a supernatural brightness. The sight left them in awe and amazement, as they beheld this being who appeared like a young man in the prime of life. This description of the figure is deliberately left open for our interpretation, as the accounts from different Gospel writers present different aspects of the encounter. The purpose of the angels was to comfort and instruct the disciples, yet the peculiar disappearances and reappearances can be perplexing. Nonetheless, the remarkable detail of the angel's clothing, as white as snow, is a testament to his divine nature and the life that knows no decay.

Entering into the tomb, they were amazed to see a figure clothed in a long white garment, a vision that radiated with supernatural brightness. This appearance of a young man, seemingly in the prime of life, left them in awe and wonder. The purpose of the angels was to comfort and instruct the disciples, although the mysterious disappearances and reappearances can be puzzling. The exquisite detail of the angel's whitened vestment serves as a symbol of his divine nature, reflecting a life untouched by decay.

As they entered the tomb, they were astonished to see a figure dressed in a long white garment, radiating a supernatural brightness like the dazzling apparel described elsewhere. This young man, appearing in the prime of life, left them awestruck and amazed. The purpose of the angels was to comfort and instruct the disciples, although the mysterious disappearances and reappearances may perplex us. The angel's pure white robe serves as a reminder of his divine nature, untouched by decay and symbolizing his heavenly existence.

Entering the tomb, they were amazed to find a figure clothed in a long white garment, radiating a supernatural brightness. This description hints at the appearance of the angel, who seemed to be in the bloom of a life untouched by decay. The purpose of the angels was to comfort and instruct the disciples, yet the mysterious disappearances and reappearances may perplex us. The angel's dazzling white robe signifies his divine nature, a heavenly messenger sent to bring awe and wonder to those who behold him.

Entering the tomb, they were astonished to see a figure clothed in a long white garment, radiating with a supernatural brightness. This young man, appearing in the prime of life, left them awestruck and amazed. The purpose of the angels was to comfort and instruct the disciples, although the mysterious disappearances and reappearances may perplex us. The angel's pure white robe serves as a reminder of his divine nature, untouched by decay, symbolizing his heavenly existence.
